content: changelingcolouredyarns dark ages mittens a pattern by melissafleur hughes when the mornings are dark and winter feels like it will never end then these are the mittens i need they start with a stretchy band on the fingers which soon doubles so you can fold your fingers inside the mittens the pattern continues with other stretchy stitch combinations to make a snug fit with negative ease they are also stretchy lengthwise and i usually wear them bunched up over the knuckles but the mittens will almost cover the whole length of the fingers when you need extra warmth the pattern is designed for a large woman s hand but tips are given to adjust to smaller sizes the construction is in the round and from the finger tips up to the wrist notions  2 x 35g balls of plump 4 ply wool or 5ply sport weight yarn this can be made with mini gradients or a single ball of solid or variegated yarn  3 5 mm to 4mm hook or to suit your gauge i used a slightly smaller hook for extra stretch foundation row 20 running double_crochet or 20 foundation double_crochet if you prefer join with a slip_stitch this should make a small stretchy loop that will fit over 4 fingers for larger/smaller sizes add even numbers of dcs row 1 stacked single_crochet to start chain half_double_crochet in each stitch to end of row finishing with a chain weave in tail yarn to smooth the join 20hdc row 2 single_crochet to join *single_crochet in chain gap single_crochet in each half_double_crochet ** repeat *to ** to end of row slip_stitch to join 40 single_crochet page 1 changelingcolouredyarns row 3 working on the outside of the mitten flss in each st to end of row row 4 chain to start blhdc in each of the back loops of half_double_crochet of row2 blhdc to end of row 40 blhdc slip_stitch to join the following row is worked in the third loop of the half_double_crochet which is found behind the back loop tltr is third loop treble see stitch glossary for details row 5 working in the third loops of the previous row stacked single_crochet in third loop *skip 2 tltr in next 2 st tltr behind the previous treble_crochet in each of the skipped st** repeat * to ** to end of row finishing with skip2 tltr fpdc on stacked single_crochet tltr in skipped stitches continue in the round to next row rather than joining 40 tltr the following six row are a diagonal weave stitch made with extended double_crochet edc you can substitute treble for the edc but it will make a looser mitten the row are written as separate row with fpsc to join but you can continue in the round row 6 2 fpsc *skip 2 2 fpedc fpedc in each of the skipped st ** repeat * to ** to end of row finish with skip 2 fpdc into each of the first 2 fpsc fpedc
